column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Mapudungun alphabet, written in the Latin script.

name
  1. Mapuche; An indigenous group of inhabitants of Central and Southern Chile and Southern Argentina.
  2. The language of the Mapuche people.

adj
  1. Of, from, or pertaining to the Mapuche.

noun
  1. A person of the Mapuche.

name
  1. The Mapudungun language; A language isolate spoken in Chile and Argentina by the Mapuche people.

name
  1. A language isolate spoken in Chile and Argentina by the Mapuche people.

name
  1. The Mapudungun language; A language isolate spoken in Chile and Argentina by the Mapuche people.

name
  1. land inhabited by Mapuches at the west of the Andes.
  2. Chile.

name
  1. Eastern part of the territory inhabited by the Mapuche people located east of the Andes.
  2. Argentina

verb
  1. To be bored.
  2. First-person singular present affirmative real mood form of afeluwvn.

verb
  1. To demolish.
  2. First-person singular present affirmative real mood form of afelzuamvn.

verb
  1. To play with a toy.
  2. First-person singular present affirmative real mood form of azgejuwvn.

verb
  1. To do an evil deed with slyness.
  2. First-person singular present affirmative real mood form of azkan; I did an evil deed with slyness; I have done an evil deed with slyness.

verb
  1. To observe.
  2. First-person singular present affirmative real mood form of azkintun.

verb
  1. To take care of; To pay attention to.
  2. First-person singular present affirmative real mood form of azkintunien.

verb
  1. To clean up; To organize.
  2. First-person singular present affirmative real mood form of azkvnun; I cleaned up; I have cleaned up.

verb
  1. To come across; To find by accident.
  2. First-person singular present affirmative real mood form of azman; I came across; I have come across.

verb
  1. To understand; To know well.
  2. To learn.
  3. First-person singular present affirmative real mood form of azvmvn.

verb
  1. To be dressed up; To look good.

verb
  1. To put.
  2. To keep.
  3. To bury, to perform a burial.

adj
  1. so much
  2. as much
  3. a lot of
  4. much

adv
  1. much, a lot
  2. long, long time.
  3. so
  4. so much
  5. so long
  6. so often, very often

verb
  1. To sell.
  2. First-person singular real mood form of fenzen; I sold; I have sold.

pron
  1. Third-person singular personal pronoun. he, she, it.

noun
  1. boldo tree and its leaves used as an herbal remedy

verb
  1. To smell.
  2. To sense smell.
  3. To sniff, to sense.

noun
  1. knowledge, as in acquaintance or familiarity with a person, place, or subject.
  2. wisdom
  3. learning

verb
  1. To know.
  2. To understand.
  3. To learn.

noun
  1. Dombey's beech a tree native to South America

verb
  1. to go to bed, to lie down

verb
  1. To bury, to place in the ground.

verb
  1. To run away, to flee, to escape.

verb
  1. To light, to set fire to.
  2. To switch on.
  3. To burn.

noun
  1. Mapuche spiritual authority, expert in the sciences and techniques of curing.

noun
  1. land, territory, country
  2. space, room
  3. Territorial space and all the natural elements in it.
  4. earth, soil

noun
  1. The drink maté, prepared of yerba mate (Ilex paraguariensis).

noun
  1. Type of bread made from wheat prepared in different ways.

adj
  1. a lot, very much, a great deal

adv
  1. a lot, very much

verb
  1. To take a bath, to bathe.
  2. To go for a swim.

verb
  1. To let go of.
  2. To release, to set free.

verb
  1. To steady, to hold on to.
  2. To fasten.

noun
  1. headdress made of herbs, flowers, feathers, or ribbon

noun
  1. brother
  2. A male cousin.
  3. A male person who is Mapuche.
  4. Someone who is a peer, whether male or female.

verb
  1. To be called, to call oneself.
  2. First-person singular real mood form of pigen; I am called; My name is.

noun
  1. (anatomy) heart
  2. relative; Someone in the same family.

verb
  1. To bury, to place in the ground.

verb
  1. To bury, to place in the ground.

noun
  1. (anatomy) hair (a single hair)
  2. (anatomy) All the hair on the head

verb
  1. To obey.
  2. To answer, to reply, to respond.

noun
  1. Mapuche leader during times of war, commander.
  2. Ceremonial axe of power.
  3. axe

character
  1. The twenty-fourth letter of the Mapudungun alphabet, written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. shore or bank of a watercourse.
  2. edge, border

verb
  1. to light, to set fire to.
  2. to switch on.

verb
  1. To order, to issue a command.
  2. To send a messenger.

verb
  1. To combat, to fight against.
  2. To wage war.

noun
  1. a male-bodied individual who fulfils a third gender role in Mapudungun society often as a shaman or a machi; sometimes used to refer to effeminate men or simply homosexual men.

verb
  1. To be a weye, a third gender machi (Mapuche shaman)

noun
  1. sodomy (used almost exclusively for homosexual relations)

noun
  1. Someone that is not Mapuche; Someone that is foreign.
  2. The white man.
  3. oppressor
  4. thief; crook

noun
  1. A language that is not Mapudungun.

name
  1. The Spanish language.

verb
  1. To walk.
  2. First-person singular present affirmative real mood form of xekan; I walked; I have walked.

verb
  1. To emerge, to appear
  2. To rise, to arise.

verb
  1. to try; especially, to put forth effort or to attempt.
  2. to think.
  3. to reflect, to think.

verb
  1. To need.
  2. To desire, to want, to wish.

verb
  1. to take an enemy's severed head in as a war trophy

verb
  1. To pick up.
  2. To gather, to collect.
  3. To grab, to catch.
